getTypedList

public static <T> java.util.List<T> getTypedList(java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                                 java.lang.Object obj,
                                                 java.lang.String... delimiters)
returns the properly typed list. The list will *always* be a new list, even if the passed in obj is the properly typed list. If the obj is a string then it will be split using the passed in delimiters. Never returns an empty list, will only return null.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
cls -
obj -
delimiters -
Returns:

toList

public static java.util.List toList(java.lang.Object obj,
                                    java.lang.String... delimiters)
converts to a list. will convert: Collection Enumeration Object[] String (will split based on delimiters). in all other cases: Will return null on null value. otherwise will return a list of length 1, with the value

Parameters:
obj -
delimiters -
Returns:
